document.title: Alabama Course of Study: English Language Arts

F8DD4D21864A4D9AA72BA7E7CF4BD71A.description: With guidance and support, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, working both independently and collaboratively with peers.

43959B853CBA4BF697A3E83AF262C0ED.description: Gather information from provided sources for research and writing projects.

DA60D598F72743878D1CD7D9D01BCC1B.description: Include information recalled from personal experiences in research and writing projects.

F7E07F654B0A4163AC028F05D3E98FF9.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects to answer a question or describe a topic.

080B791FAA1E4483BB1217B7096B3A64.description: Improve pictorial and written presentations, as needed, by planning, revising, editing, and using suggestions from peers and adults.

1C0421D9763B41F4A5F7B6E04B82F2DC.description: With prompting and support, compose writing for varied purposes and audiences, across different genres.

BD378A0598E64FC89C0C6FAD777C5566.description: Actively participate in shared writing experiences to create explanatory texts or provide factual information about a topic, using drawing, dictating, and/or writing.

37BF0B13D2E541B7A22042D7A2F41D31.description: Actively participate in shared writing experiences to create opinion pieces about a topic or text, state the opinion, supply a reason for the opinion, and provide a sense of closure, using drawing, dictating, and/or writing.

70274EEADBD84311A2843D412B444940.description: Actively participate in shared writing experiences to create narratives with the events in chronological order and share feelings about the story, using drawing, dictating, and/or writing.

FBD55FE1360B47D3BCDA3D347A692CC0.description: Actively participate in shared writing experiences to create messages, lists, and labels for a drawing or illustration.

8C572DA25B6D45BBB7DD1AEC74EBE7EC.description: Actively participate in shared and independent writing experiences, for varied purposes and audiences, across different genres.

612F0ADC9CEF4EF4825B3D48123FC7FE.description: With prompting and support, recognize, name, and correctly use end punctuation.

FD14F71CB5A74E419AEDBFBD11DB69FD.description: With prompting and support, capitalize the pronoun I and names of individuals.

B193EBA7AC7246718E4621F90AB5D78D.description: With prompting and support, begin each sentence with a capital letter.

2755667DC409487E8267DA1A147363D2.description: With prompting and support, write the correct number of words, with proper spacing, for a spoken phrase or sentence.

74FDD65E44B54B32866CB01EE957DD70.description: With prompting and support, identify the role or purpose of a noun and a verb within a sentence and the type of information it conveys.

EC270F047B29437BA565CC75821854FB.description: With prompting and support, compose a simple sentence, including necessary components to create a complete sentence rather than a fragment.

E9E7D433CA5E4F71B76865C2F6A9BD0F.description: With prompting and support, transcribe spoken words to demonstrate that print represents oral language.

B9343BCB936C4B059F73EBA99056F760.description: When speaking and writing, follow the rules of standard English grammar, punctuation, capitalization, and grade-appropriate spelling.

5889D1D664A14D2EA504B87C7523F4A5.description: With prompting and support, encode grade-appropriate high frequency words that follow regular phoneme-grapheme correspondences and patterns in all but one position, pointing out the part of the word that does not follow the regular pattern.

8DAF994456044E1AB46BC1C94F033BF9.description: With prompting and support, encode grade-appropriate high frequency words that follow regular phoneme-grapheme correspondences.

993E43A06B1F4D5ABF4A8D45E6C89216.description: With prompting and support, encode vowel-consonant (VC) and consonant-vowel-consonant (CVC) words, while using some knowledge of basic position-based rules for spelling English words.

432E12AD6517444DA4ABB6E90E38D121.description: Encode at the phoneme level, using the most common grapheme/spelling(s), for a spoken phoneme (sound).

4CE62DC743A54515B69C311F62222028.description: Apply knowledge of grade-appropriate phoneme-grapheme correspondences and spelling rules (or generalizations) to encode words accurately.

E05EFC228132400590735E5947E19D25.description: With prompting and support, use lower case letters in majority of written work, using capitals only when appropriate.

E91AB892D8FD4CE2AAB44DD61AABC8C0.description: With prompting and support, print first and last names using proper letter formation, capitalizing only the first letter of each name.

CBC7C321D0634B58946E637B57609C60.description: Print upper and lower case letters using proper approach strokes, letter formation, and line placement.

42786C9AD3684978BCD2E98965BB1D30.description: Print legibly, using proper pencil grip.

14EABE8B815B4D2695AE96ED065884DC.description: Express ideas orally and connect these ideas through drawing and emergent writing.

1B266D4F48D64BCC8D2BBA5BB01366A9.description: Compare and contrast two informational texts on the same topic.

D33DBF6117794D4C8D14507B158CCCBB.description: Compare and contrast the experiences of characters in a literary text.

6C98220E331C45379BAC28E0724685BD.description: Distinguish between literary texts and informational texts.

1B6120A7FE924CB8A9E1B22FBAD9467E.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast two texts.

D23C7284784B4824858B44B46256F5F3.description: With prompting and support, self-monitor comprehension of text by pausing to summarize and rereading for clarification, when comprehension is lacking.

D85E53BDD64949688AD3FAF051FF96EF.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in literary and informational texts.

1AA3FDD7DAF04077A3A9FB0F7C592812.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and key details in an informational text.

F0DE34BD8CA748CDB6A286BFC44B14E8.description: With prompting and support, use text clues to determine main ideas and make predictions about an ending in a literary text.

B0872D904B434F06A1DA919DEA43ABA3.description: With prompting and support, retell a text orally, including main character(s), setting, and important events in logical order.

367B512C85364A89A9C840CDC7615B6C.description: Identify and describe the main story elements in a literary text.

AE5DC69578D44F09841B0B0093DCBE86.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear.

C42B4D995C7B4E37AB096644FD178A76.description: With prompting and support, identify the topic of texts, using titles, headings, illustrations, and text clues.

F83E4B4E88F044DF80F9A0A7E0DED2CC.description: With prompting and support, identify common types of texts and their features, including literary, informational, fairy tale, and poetry.

7235DE3090D743F49893C59752EE7895.description: With prompting and support, manipulate words and/or phrases to create simple sentences, including declarative and interrogative, to help build syntactic awareness and comprehension at the sentence level.

263692A349044CE2A51382E62EBABF2F.description: Use content knowledge built during read-alouds of informational texts by participating in content-specific discussions with peers and/or through drawing or writing.

C7624594B01B4D0BBA5C7F3B661AAFD9.description: Use new words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to text.

37790962E3804B8BA9AF228A1A6F8EED.description: Use previously-taught vocabulary words, including nouns, verbs, and adjectives, in speaking and writing.

F60A748197C54715BE24BC865EEB9AE3.description: Use new and previously-taught vocabulary to produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

CE41AF89760F4777818BAB6637CF3345.description: Name and sort pictures of objects into categories based on common attributes while relating vocabulary to prior knowledge and building background knowledge.

84590B4476AF40ADA7844D015B29C92B.description: Describe the relationship between words, including relating them to synonyms and antonyms.

6FC3C48F4BE84C18AD4439AC3217E623.description: Ask and answer questions about unfamiliar words in discussions and/or text.

E4C610A05FF747739833EF1FA3B5AC5C.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately.

039A06BB62044D4EB1B25E4975658127.description: With guidance and support, orally utilize new academic, content-specific, grade-level vocabulary and relate new words to prior knowledge.

C656AEB93D2B4292B43119DF16B2CC59.description: Recognize and read grade-appropriate high frequency words with accuracy and automaticity.

F9896B5033D84D66A7C8E70AEEA28534.description: Orally read and reread grade-appropriate decodable texts smoothly, accurately, and expressively, at an appropriate rate to support comprehension.

6AB215D69CC942BEB2AC01A64B692DA1.description: Apply previously-taught phoneme-grapheme correspondences to decodable words with accuracy and automaticity, in and out of context.

3CD4EEB1129942FFB665FB2AEFB5B5F5.description: With prompting and support, recognize and name digraphs ck, sh, th, ch, wh, ng, and combination qu.

178E37AF66C446638D9ECCB15BED5D12.description: Arrange and name letters of the alphabet in sequential order from a to z, with accuracy and automaticity.

6E20A75135BF46F79A4079F7F2A8A62D.description: Recognize and name all upper and lower case letters in non-sequential order with accuracy and automaticity.

C7D89360B975429195D867A115BBE0FD.description: Decode grade-appropriate high frequency words that are spelled using predictable, decodable phoneme-grapheme correspondences.

7F82E1AFD06C4FD89AAF96F62BA87EDF.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the phonemes and graphemes that differ.

0D08CAFFD4254E7581CE0187AB677B87.description: With prompting and support, produce the most frequent sound for digraphs ck, sh, th, ch, wh, ng, and combination qu, making the connection that a two-letter grapheme can represent one phoneme (sound).

CC58BFF343AF4D469B9F9CBA27D2DF28.description: With prompting and support, decode words with suffix -s, using knowledge of unvoiced /s/ and voiced /z/ sounds for letter s.

091AF6100EF144CE92729398649E3894.description: With prompting and support, identify the vowel-consonant-e syllable pattern and produce the long vowel sounds for the five major vowels in vowel-consonant-e syllables.

3BD2BA49FFEF451B8093E008C7FE956D.description: Identify the vowel in an open syllable and produce the long vowel sound for the five major vowels when decoding open syllables.

1ABFF364E2F441DD958B7A4A881E8722.description: Decode consonant-vowel-consonant (CVC) words in isolation and in decodable text.

4775929E9A644BBE8C0607322F5CA68B.description: Identify the vowel in a closed syllable and produce the short vowel sound for the five major vowels when decoding closed syllables.

3457CC23747B4F818E88F3D6DA34EB7D.description: Produce the most frequent sound(s) for each consonant, including x and q, which have two phonemes (sounds).

38E7EDFEB26B425FB05DED32D0A398DA.description: Apply knowledge of phoneme-grapheme correspondences and word-analysis skills to decode and encode (spell) words accurately in both isolation and in decodable, grade-appropriate text.

B3E6DBE698D3417B94248F771D299308.description: Distinguish between commonly confused cognate consonant sounds, using knowledge of voiced and unvoiced sounds and manner of articulation.

F93567A276F44BD49E9005A13928C6FB.description: Blend and segment phonemes in single-syllable spoken words made up of three to four phonemes.

F22B7E1D03C94F5698BDFBF6270E97BE.description: Identify the initial, final, and medial sounds of spoken words.

ABF202609D654977A937337BCF2838B2.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

9165449F70694E6BAD9251256EDE6BF3.description: Count, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words, including compound words.

86E4AB1160E044C49CFF0E7F042E61BD.description: Recognize and produce pairs of rhyming words and distinguish them from non-rhyming pairs using pictures and/or spoken words.

3DB04CCDE4F843A9B5FB5ABEEAE522A3.description: Count the number of words in a spoken sentence.

0F22282E44444D74B24876202E84F626.description: Demonstrate early phonological awareness to basic phonemic awareness skills in spoken words.

418C17C2EB2E47679B398D229F08F054.description: Compare and contrast letters based upon similarities and differences, including name, shape, sound, and approach strokes for writing.

B5E82D7464D24B28B9DB813918650539.description: Distinguish letters from words within sentences.

24EC2FD9520640B09E3EC6A9DB5EFF83.description: Point to words using one-to-one correspondence, noting that words are separated by spaces.

67C639FF0563467D84FDECEB6EBC2994.description: Identify the beginning and end of a sentence by locating the capital letter and end punctuation.

B1F2E77647D4471C81CFF5A95FA43B01.description: Track print, moving left to right and top to bottom on the printed page, returning to the beginning of the next line.

3BF9275593194F3287A470897793B467.description: With prompting and support, explain the roles of the author and illustrator of a text.

D704BB303622480196B3F7E2CE4C536D.description: Recognize and demonstrate that print conveys meaning.

CE543E15F7584FBDAE2F12E7E220356C.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of printed materials.

DC404363834E41FCBB38DEF0CDD61897.description: Restate and follow one- and two-step directions.

14B5C6E6BBF5402EA72B3F41867F7DE6.description: Uses spatial and temporal concepts correctly.

32346AA594EB4CFF809D4CF37A59860A.description: Describe people, places, things, and events with relevant details in a story with three to five events.

AAD77728397F47859810EEF72B67CDC4.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

35ABC73EF63544C3A3FDD654BE61059E.description: With guidance and support, present information orally, using complete sentences in correct word order.

9732F343EEE945A79F7B2AE712A29061.description: With guidance and support, ask and answer questions to seek help, get information, or clarify information presented orally, through text, or other media.

220B4F0C3DA44170BABBA420B28BF47F.description: Actively participate in teacher-led choral and shared reading experiences.

7019C154B629495F9B868B316B4C4F6C.description: Actively engage in teacher-led reading experiences and collaborative discussions with peers to build background knowledge needed to be successful as they learn to read and, later, read to learn.

1FA551FD54AF4D0799AC0938132E34A4.description: Listen to others and take turns speaking, carrying on a conversation through multiple exchanges.

96366406FE314B788843A1D2F1099016.description: Use age-appropriate irregular plurals in conversation.

8BA9B97722CE4F0CB831F354BF929A9E.description: Use word endings to indicate plurals, possessives, and verb tenses in speech.

25ACC8593CA54168812FB04CE5E213EC.description: Use speech that is understandable with only grade-appropriate errors.

F71D7D897C824055B9EFFA7ADF2E894E.description: Actively listen and speak using agreed-upon rules for discussion, with guidance and support.

156070917421468B9AEE1FF0E7896B71.description: Utilize the writing process to plan, draft, revise, edit, and publish writings in various genres.

245F96D5F90349E4A09ADCE759A7530B.description: Use digital and electronic tools appropriately, safely, and ethically for research and writing, both individually and collaboratively.

6C2B39AF8DB34E5C9390FAA011F06DC3.description: Expand background knowledge and build vocabulary through discussion, reading, and writing.

41E4D465E37F493CBFA755316FF7434C.description: Use knowledge of phoneme-grapheme correspondences and word analysis skills to decode and encode words accurately.

2BD60B8C942A4E75AAA1D042CD424448.description: Utilize active listening skills during discussion and conversation in pairs, small groups, or whole-class settings, following agreed-upon rules for participation.
